title: Lombo da Raiz
body: A place in the parish of Santo da Serra, where a small house can serve as a shelter for those passing by, and where the waters of the Levada da Serra are also separated for their own aqueduct. These waters irrigate the parishes of Caniço, São Gonçalo, and Santa Maria Maior. These waters come in common, up to Lombo da Raiz, with those of the Levada do Juncal destined for the parishes of Santo da Serra, Água de Pena, and Santa Cruz, and with those of the Levada Nova do Furado, which fertilizes the lands of the parish of Santa Cruz.
